channel.title: Java Practice: Is this code valid?

item.title: Java Practice: Is this code valid?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

This section is for RSPS Server help only, but from what I can tell, you only made two errors, Ill highlight them for you.

Your code:

[b]C[/b]lass Bicycle { 
         int cadence = 0;
         int speed = 0;
         int gear = 1;

         void changeCadence (int newValue) {
                 cadence = newValue;

}

         void changeGear (int newValue) {
                 gear = newValue;

}

        void speedUp (int increment) {
                speed = speed + increment;

}

        void applyBrakes (int decrement) {
                speed = speed - decrement;

}

        void printStates() {
               System.out.[b]printIn[/b] ("cadence:"+cadence+" speed:"+speed+" gear: "+gear);

}

}

The C in Class should be lowercase: class
System.out.printIn, the actual method is println.
Those are the only two errors, but you did not follow coding conventions, which is completely understandable for a beginner.

Correct code:

[code=Java]class Bicycle {

int cadence = 0;
int speed = 0;
int gear = 1;

void changeCadence(int newValue) {
	cadence = newValue;
}

void changeGear(int newValue) {
	gear = newValue;
}

void speedUp(int increment) {
	speed = speed + increment;
}

void applyBrakes(int decrement) {
	speed = speed - decrement;
}

void printStates() {
	System.out.println("cadence:" + cadence + " speed:" + speed + " gear:" + gear);
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Java Practice: Is this code valid?

item.title: Java Practice: Is this code valid?
item.dc:creator: @Elitobot Elitobot
item.description:
@Elitobot wrote:

Well I am learning on the website, trying to memorize how to type up a class. You may know this is the code from the Object-Oriented section of the Java tutorials, I just need to know if I typed it up correctly.

[code]Class Bicycle {

         int cadence = 0;
         int speed = 0;
         int gear = 1;

         void changeCadence (int newValue) {
                 cadence = newValue;

}

         void changeGear (int newValue) {
                 gear = newValue;

}

        void speedUp (int increment) {
                speed = speed + increment;

}

        void applyBrakes (int decrement) {
                speed = speed - decrement;

}

        void printStates() {
               System.out.printIn ("cadence:"+cadence+" speed:"+speed+" gear: "+gear);

}

}[/code]

Read full topic
